vocabulary.meaning: Fluent and persuasive in speaking or writing
vocabulary.example: The eloquent speaker captivated the entire audience with her passionate speech.

vocabulary.meaning: Able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions
vocabulary.example: Despite facing many challenges, she remained resilient and never gave up on her dreams.

vocabulary.meaning: Delay or postpone action; put off doing something
vocabulary.example: Don't procrastinate on your homework - it's better to start early and avoid the stress.

vocabulary.meaning: The occurrence of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way
vocabulary.example: Meeting her future business partner at the coffee shop was pure serendipity.

vocabulary.meaning: Lasting for a very short time
vocabulary.example: The beauty of cherry blossoms is ephemeral, lasting only a few weeks in spring.

vocabulary.meaning: Dealing with things sensibly and realistically
vocabulary.example: She took a pragmatic approach to solving the budget crisis, focusing on practical solutions.

vocabulary.meaning: Present, appearing, or found everywhere
vocabulary.example: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society, found in nearly everyone's pocket.

vocabulary.meaning: A person or thing that precipitates an event or change
vocabulary.example: The new technology served as a catalyst for rapid innovation in the industry.

vocabulary.meaning: Quick and active; lively
vocabulary.example: She took a brisk walk every morning.

vocabulary.meaning: More than enough; plentiful
vocabulary.example: There was ample food for everyone at the party.

vocabulary.meaning: Careful to avoid potential problems or dangers
vocabulary.example: He was cautious when crossing the busy street.

vocabulary.meaning: Having or showing care and conscientiousness in one's work or duties
vocabulary.example: She is a diligent student who always completes her assignments.

vocabulary.meaning: Careful with money; thrifty
vocabulary.example: He is frugal and always looks for the best deals.

vocabulary.meaning: Fond of company; sociable
vocabulary.example: She is gregarious and loves meeting new people.

vocabulary.meaning: To make it difficult for something to happen
vocabulary.example: Heavy traffic can hinder your progress.

vocabulary.meaning: Perfect, without mistakes or faults
vocabulary.example: Her manners are impeccable.

vocabulary.meaning: Cheerful and friendly
vocabulary.example: He was in a jovial mood at the party.

vocabulary.meaning: Having or showing eagerness or enthusiasm
vocabulary.example: She is keen to learn new skills.

vocabulary.meaning: Expressed clearly; easy to understand
vocabulary.example: His explanation was lucid and easy to follow.

vocabulary.meaning: Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise
vocabulary.example: She is meticulous in her work.

vocabulary.meaning: Quick and light in movement or action
vocabulary.example: The dancer was nimble on her feet.

vocabulary.meaning: Not discovered or known about; uncertain
vocabulary.example: The meaning of the poem was obscure.

vocabulary.meaning: Think about something carefully
vocabulary.example: He likes to ponder big questions.

vocabulary.meaning: Attractively unusual or old-fashioned
vocabulary.example: They stayed in a quaint cottage.

vocabulary.meaning: Strong and healthy; vigorous
vocabulary.example: The system is robust and can handle heavy loads.

vocabulary.meaning: Examine or inspect closely and thoroughly
vocabulary.example: The scientist will scrutinize the results.

vocabulary.meaning: Perceptible by touch; clear and definite
vocabulary.example: There was no tangible evidence of the crime.

vocabulary.meaning: To raise or improve something
vocabulary.example: The music helped uplift her spirits.

vocabulary.meaning: Producing powerful feelings or strong, clear images in the mind
vocabulary.example: She gave a vivid description of the scene.

vocabulary.meaning: Feeling or showing caution about possible dangers or problems
vocabulary.example: He was wary of strangers.

vocabulary.meaning: Have an intense feeling of longing for something
vocabulary.example: She yearned for a holiday.

vocabulary.meaning: Having or showing great energy or enthusiasm
vocabulary.example: He is zealous in his pursuit of success.

vocabulary.meaning: Existing or available in large quantities
vocabulary.example: There was abundant rainfall this year.

vocabulary.meaning: Well meaning and kindly
vocabulary.example: She was a benevolent leader.

vocabulary.meaning: To agree
vocabulary.example: I concur with your opinion.

vocabulary.meaning: To diminish gradually in size, amount, or strength
vocabulary.example: The supplies began to dwindle.

vocabulary.meaning: Wanting to do or have something very much
vocabulary.example: She was eager to start her new job.

vocabulary.meaning: Understand after much thought
vocabulary.example: He couldn't fathom why she left.

vocabulary.meaning: To seize and hold firmly; to understand
vocabulary.example: He tried to grasp the concept.

vocabulary.meaning: Pay attention to; take notice of
vocabulary.example: You should heed the warning signs.

vocabulary.meaning: Continuing without pause or interruption
vocabulary.example: The incessant noise made it hard to concentrate.

vocabulary.meaning: Special words or expressions used by a profession or group
vocabulary.example: Legal jargon can be confusing.

vocabulary.meaning: To start a fire; to inspire
vocabulary.example: The teacher kindled a love of reading in her students.

vocabulary.meaning: Sluggish and apathetic
vocabulary.example: He felt lethargic after staying up all night.

vocabulary.meaning: Lacking interest or excitement; dull
vocabulary.example: He found the task mundane.

vocabulary.meaning: A conception of or belief about something
vocabulary.example: She had a notion to travel the world.

vocabulary.meaning: Make (someone) legally or morally bound to do something
vocabulary.example: He was obliged to help his friend.

vocabulary.meaning: To confuse or puzzle
vocabulary.example: The question perplexed the students.

vocabulary.meaning: Satisfy (one's thirst) by drinking
vocabulary.example: He quenched his thirst with cold water.

vocabulary.meaning: Feel deep respect or admiration for something
vocabulary.example: Many people revere historical leaders.
